meta.name: description
meta.content: Jolokia is an alernative to JSR-160 connectors for remote JMX access. It provides REST-like access to JMX with JSON over HTTP.

body.div:
Jolokia is remote JMX with JSON over HTTP.
It is fast, simple, polyglot and has unique features. It's JMX on Capsaicin.
body.p: Jolokia is a JMX-HTTP bridge giving an alternative to JSR-160 connectors. It is an agent based approach with support for many platforms. In addition to basic JMX operations it enhances JMX remoting with unique features like bulk requests or fine grained security policies.

ul.li: Overview of Features which make Jolokia unique for JMX remoting.
The Documentation includes a tutorial and a reference manual.
Agents are available for many platforms (JEE, OSGi, Mule, JDK6 JVM).
The support page contains information for how to get Jolokia support and how to participate in the evolution of Jolokia.

subsection.name: www.jolokia.org launched
subsection.p: Finally, www.jolokia.org has arrived. It provides many pieces of useful information about Jolokia, but is not completely finished yet. The reference manual needs still some work as well as some other pages. Hopefully you enjoy it nevertheless. Feedback is highly appreciated.
Release soon, release often. That's what they told me.

subsection.name: Jolokia 0.80 released
subsection.p: The first version of Jolokia has been released. Version 0.80 can be obtained from the Download page and from our maven repository. This version is identical to the agent part of jmx4perl 0.72, feature- and codewise. Future versions of jmx4perl will be packaged without agent but with a dependency on Jolokia.
